reviewText: I was tempted to save myself the effort of a semi-long review and just smugly declare this the NEW DEVILS SHARE.  In SPACE, no less!  Then it occurred to me that unless I also incorporated words like spoopy" and "pants" into my review

hoursPlayed: hopefully FOREVER.)\n\nREALLY nifty opening cut-scene.  One of those classic

reviewText:
Avoid like the plague.

You will die for absolutely no reason.

You start off with like 100 or so bullets, and a monster can consume all 100 of them and not die.  But others will die sooner, it is almost like the laser sight is terribly inaccurate.

It seems impossible to beat the elevator level to me.  I tied and tried and it doesn't even make sense.  You just die.

Let's say you put all 100 bullets into one enemy.  Go back to the main menu, start a new fresh game.  You still won't have any bullets.  They don't reset.  It's that bad.  Also, you can shoot your gun after you are dead.  And you can shoot your gun in the main menu as well.

There are no reloading animations, although there is a sound when the gun fires, it doesn't even make a click noise when you run out.  The enemy animations and models are really poor.  The graphics provided by the Unreal 4 engine look amazing with all these blindingly bright flashes of light but it doesn't help the game.

AVOID.  It's not even a game.  You will regret your time spent playing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pPhZZtE_mhg

reviewText:
The sound and level design of this game is an insult. I get it, it's a game made by one man, but instead of doing things he doesn't know jack about, maybe he should've delegate.

The sound design of this game, or the lack of it makes you feel crippled all the time and leaves you constantly questioning your hardware. Even worse — it gives you no audial feedback whatsoever. You somehow supposed to stomach the fact, that you make no sounds, apart from reloading. What is it? A feature? No one can hear your scream in space? Yeah right, lazy sound design more like it.

The level design is absolutely terrible, I had no a slightest clue which of the locations I've visited and which are new. And don't get me started on crouching in this game or UI for that matter.

This thing should be free as any proof of concept. Though I fail to grasp what concept this one was supposed to proof because it proved none I feel appropriate to mention.

Granted, I played only 9 minutes, but I fail to see how it could get better from such a start. So if you like me was after something like System Shock or say Dead Effect, forget about it. This thing is more along the lines of EYE or whatever that convoluted thing was called, but worse on any level.

Buy Dead Effect instead, which deserves extra attention even if it looks ugly (the main reason why I gave this one a shot).

reviewText: I really liked the atmosphere on this one. Sort of early 8-bit era kind of storytelling where you don't really understand what's going on from time to time, but as a whole it makes a mesmerising picture. The graphics are pretty cool (haven't played too many games on U4 yet, but this one looks really nice). The ambient sounds are great imo, help to build the pressure a lot. But yeah, the not so great part is that the game lacks technical polish. The main menu looks like a dev version and sometimes during the game you don't understand what's happening at all, which can add to the atmosphere a bit, seeing this is a horror game and all, but for modern games you have to have more clarity in terms of gameplay mechanics. Overall I think it's a pretty interesting game for its price, but I really hope author will address some of the technical issues it has.
